business.headline: Gold loses shine as US-China trade talks ease market jittersThe US and China ended high-stakes trade talks on a positive note on Sunday, with US officials touting a "deal" to reduce the U.S. trade deficit, while Chinese officials said they had reached an "important consensus".

Sensex jumps 2,700 points to cross 82,000 mark for 1st time in 7 monthsThe stock market rally was led by easing geopolitical tensions, supportive global cues, and renewed investor confidence after a sovereign credit upgrade.

IndusInd Bank faces tough questions from auditors over possible fraud: ReportSo far, IndusInd Bank has described the issue as a 'discrepancy'. This is the term it has used in its stock exchange notices and in talks with analysts and credit rating firms.

ITR Filing 2025: Opting for old tax regime? Here's why Form 10-IEA is a mustForm 10-IEA is a declaration form for those who do not want to follow the new tax regime. If you earn income from a business or profession, and you wish to continue with the old tax regime, this form is essential.

US and China pause tariff war for 90 days, to slash reciprocal duties by 115%Under the agreement, the US will reduce tariffs on Chinese goods from 145% to 30%, while China will slash its tariffs on American imports from 125% to 10%, according to a joint statement.

Dalal Street soars after ceasefire. Should you buy, hold or sell stocks?After today's euphoric rally driven by the ceasefire between India and Pakistan, investors are basking in green screens. But with uncertainty still looming, the big question remains—what should they do next?

YES Bank share price rises 9%. Here's whyThe stake sale news led to a rise in Yes Bank's stock price, making it one of the top gainers of the day. The share price of Yes Bank went up by as much as 9% during the trading session.

EPFO services simplified: Now check your PF balance with just a call or SMSBefore you use these services, make sure your Universal Account Number (UAN) is active and linked to at least one of these: your bank account, Aadhaar number or PAN. Also, your mobile number must be registered with your UAN on the EPFO portal.

Pakistan's stock exchange halts trading for an hour. Here's whyAccording to a notification from the Pakistan Stock Exchange (PSX), all equity and equity-based markets were temporarily suspended after the KSE-30 index rose more than 5% from the previous session's close — the threshold for a market halt under PSX rules.

Eternal, Adani Ports, Infosys: Top stocks as Sensex jumps over 2,000 pointsEternal (Zomato) led the gains, surging nearly 5% to become the top performer on the 30-share BSE Sensex. Other major gainers included Adani Ports, NTPC and HCLTech, all trading up more than 4%.

Will India's trade with Turkey, Azerbaijan suffer amid tensions with Pakistan?Over the years, the trade between India and Azerbaijan has grown significantly, jumping from $50 million in 2005 to $1.435 billion in 2023. Further, India imported goods worth $1.235 billion and exported products worth $201 million to Azerbaijan, according to the official data.
Pakistan stock market jumps over 9% as India ceasefire brings calmPakistan's benchmark index surged over 9% on Monday, while Dalal Street also saw gains with Sensex and Nifty jumping 3%.

entertainment.headline: SRK worked 36 hours straight on Circus, reveals co-star Renuka ShahaneRenuka Shahane recalled how Shah Rukh Khan worked tirelessly for 36 hours straight during the shoot of 'Circus.' She also shared a valuable piece of advice SRK gave her, which helped her overcome her fears on set.
Actor Chaitannya Choudhry changes name to Dhruv: This is not an endTelevision actor Chaitannya Choudhry announced that he has changed his name to Dhruv. He shared a statement and announced the same.

I want to make Master 2 with Vijay over Leo 2, says director Lokesh KanagarajWhile fans await updates on 'Leo 2', Lokesh Kanagaraj revealed he's more interested in exploring JD's arc with a sequel to 'Master' than Leo Das.

Lokesh Kanagaraj on why Rajinikanth isn't for Vikram, Kamal Haasan for CoolieTamil director Lokesh Kanagaraj, whose upcoming film 'Coolie' starring Rajinikanth is one of the highly anticipated Indian films of the year, recently spoke about the difference in writing scenes for Thalaivar and Kamal Haasan.

Dude: Pradeep Ranganathan goes shirtless in new poster, film to release on DiwaliTamil actor Pradeep Ranganathan's upcoming film 'Dude' will shine this Diwali. On Sunday, the makers unveiled a brand-new poster featuring a shirtless Ranganathan alongside his female lead Mamitha Baiju.

Amber Heard celebrates Mother's Day by announcing birth of twinsHollywood actor Amber Heard joyously announced the birth of her twins on International Mother's Day 2025, sharing her journey of motherhood and fertility challenges. She now has a son named Ocean and a daughter named Agnes, alongside her elder daughter Oonagh.

Suniel Shetty reacts to Anil Kapoor's '50% wale heroes' comment on Mohra poster Suniel Shetty recently addressed Anil Kapoor's past remark, where he had referred to him and Akshay Kumar as '50 per cent wale heroes' during the release of Mohra. Shetty acknowledged that the comment had hurt him initially but also served as motivation.

Anurag Kashyap slams pan-India films, calls them 'massive-scam'Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap criticised the trend of 'Pan-India' films, calling it a "massive scam" that prioritises profit over storytelling. He warned that chasing box office formulas is leading to a creative decline in Indian cinema.

Bharti Singh responds to trolls questioning her Thailand trip amid India-Pak clashIn her latest vlog, comedian-actor Bharti Singh got emotional as she responded to the harsh criticism she's faced for vacationing in Thailand.

Ram Charan surprises Jr NTR with early birthday wish at RRR live event. WatchRam Charan and Jr NTR shared a heartfelt moment during the 'RRR' live screening event at London's Royal Albert Hall. Charan delighted fans with an early birthday wish for Jr NTR.

Actor Vishal hospitalised after collapsing on stage, later dischargedTamil actor Vishal experienced a health scare during an event in Tamil Nadu after collapsing on stage. He was immediately rushed to the hospital and is currently in stable condition.

Harshvardhan Rane hits back at Mawra Hocane: So much hate in her speechAmid rising tensions between India and Pakistan, actor Harshvardhan Rane has responded to criticism from his Pakistani co-star Mawra Hocane regarding his withdrawal from the 'Sanam Teri Kasam' sequel.

Aly Goni trolled for India-Pakistan ceasefire violation post, actor reactsAly Goni has been targeted with abusive comments on social media following his statement on India-Pakistan ceasefire violations. The actor appealed for peace for his family and country amid the ongoing Operation Sindoor.

Simu Liu announces engagement to Allison. Florence Pugh, John Legend, congratulateCanadian actor Simu Liu is officially engaged to his longtime girlfriend Allison Hsu. The two reportedly began dating in 2022.

Comedy Khiladigalu 3 winner Rakesh Poojary dies of heart attack at 33Rakesh Poojary, Comedy Khiladigalu Season 3 winner, died due to a heart attack. The tragic incident took place during a Mehndi ceremony in Udupi district.

Anurag Kashyap says Vijay Sethupathi 'helped' him afford daughter's weddingAnurag Kashyap opened up about facing financial struggles while arranging his daughter Aaliyah's wedding. He credited actor Vijay Sethupathi for helping him secure the role in 'Maharaja', which made the wedding possible.

Mahesh Babu to share stage with Rajamouli, Jr NTR, Ram Charan at RRR London eventMahesh Babu will join the 'RRR' team members SS Rajamouli, Jr NTR and Ram Charan at the Royal Albert Hall in London on Sunday. Composer MM Keeravaani will perform with a live orchestra at the 'RRR' screening.

Samantha on having 'worst thoughts' over divorce, health issues: Didn't act on themActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu, in a recent interview, talked about having the 'worst possible thoughts' for a year. She further added that she chickened out and didn't want to act on these thoughts.

Aamir Khan, Ranveer Singh and celebs remember makeup artist Vikram GaikwadPopular Bollywood makeup artist Vikram Gaikwad died on Saturday. Aamir Khan, Ranveer Singh, Anushka Sharma and several others paid tribute to him.

general news.headline: Live: India's fight was against terrorists, pity Pak chose to intervene, says Air MarshalIndia Pakistan ceasefire live updates: India accused Pakistan of ceasefire violation hours after foreign secretary Vikram Misri announced that India and Pakistan had reached an understanding to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea with immediate effect late on Saturday. However, the situation along the LoC is stable now while western border states are on high alert. PM Modi is currently having a security meeting with NSA Ajit Doval, Defence minister Rajnath Singh, CDS Anil Chauhan and military chiefs. India and Pakistan agreed to halt military actions hours after intense cross-border strikes. The escalation followed India's Operation Sindoor, launched in response to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people.

Virat Kohli retires from Tests, marks end of an era in Indian cricketIndia's batting stalwart Virat Kohli announced his retirement from Test cricket on May 12. The 36-year-old shared a statement on his social media platforms, bringing the curtain down on a distinguished 14-year career spanning from 2011 to 2025.

US and China pause tariff war for 90 days, to slash reciprocal duties by 115%Under the agreement, the US will reduce tariffs on Chinese goods from 145% to 30%, while China will slash its tariffs on American imports from 125% to 10%, according to a joint statement.

'Ready to attack': Baloch rebels hit 51 locations in Pakistan as tensions mountThe Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) took responsibility for more than 51 attacks on Pakistani forces. The BLA urges the world, especially India, to support efforts to stop Pakistan's terrorism and prevent nuclear risks.

Why India pounding Pak airbases sent it into panic mode, causing US to step inThe impact of India's missile strikes on Pakistani airbases reverberated through Islamabad. By the evening of May 10, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio had reached out to Pakistan's Army Chief and India's S Jaishankar. According to sources, Rubio relayed that Pakistan was ready for a ceasefire.

Sensex surges over 2,000 points. Why is the stock market rallying today?Stock market rally today: The BSE Sensex was up 2270.26 points to 81,724.73 at around 9:59 am, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 714.10 points to trade at 24,722.30.

Satellite imagery confirms strikes on Pakistani military targets under Op SindoorIndia has struck many Pakistani airbases with air-launched cruise missiles (ALCM), according to satellite imagery analysis.

Karnataka Congress shares distorted J&K map, DK Shivakumar calls it minor errorKarnataka Congress sparked a political row after posting a map which showed Kashmir as a part of Pakistan. The post was deleted and those responsible were sacked, said KPCC president DK Shivakumar. This comes months after a similar map controversy in Belagavi.

Kohli retires as India's fourth-highest Test run-scorer: Career in numbersVirat Kohli retired from Test cricket with 9,230 runs from 123 Tests at an average of 46.85, including 30 centuries and 31 half-centuries. Kohli hung his boots before the tour of England, starting in June.

Proud of you: Support pours in for Vikram Misri after trolls target his familyPoliticians, former diplomats and social media users came out in support of Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri after trolls targetted him and his family.

32 airports reopen as tensions with Pakistan ease amid ceasefire talksThe decision to restart commercial air services in the affected regions, including Chandigarh and Srinagar among others, came after New Delhi and Islamabad agreed on Saturday to de-escalate the situation along the International Border.

Terror camps hit, Kashmir narrative changed: What India achieved under Op SindoorOperation Sindoor marked a decisive shift in India's counter-terror strategy, with deep strikes destroying terror camps across Pakistan and PoK. The mission exposed Pakistan's vulnerabilities, and reshaped the global narrative on Kashmir.

Emmanuel Macron, Keir Starmer caught on cam at alleged cocaine party? Here's the truthA viral video sparked claims that French President Emmanuel Macron hid a cocaine pouch during the Ukraine visit. The French media debunked the rumour, calling it an "absurd conspiracy" and confirming the object was just a handkerchief.

After mediation offer, US says it supports direct talks between India and PakistanUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio and UK Foreign Secretary David Lammy had a talk over the India-Pakistan issue, US Department of State Spokesperson Tammy Bruce said.

Mother kills 10-year-old with help of lover, hides chopped up body in suitcaseAssam Police arrested a woman and her lover for murdering her 10-year-old son. The woman had filed for divorce from her husband two months ago.

Will India's trade with Turkey, Azerbaijan suffer amid tensions with Pakistan?Over the years, the trade between India and Azerbaijan has grown significantly, jumping from $50 million in 2005 to $1.435 billion in 2023. Further, India imported goods worth $1.235 billion and exported products worth $201 million to Azerbaijan, according to the official data.

Biggest solar storm in 2024 heated Earth's atmosphere at 1,150°CIn the air, the threat of higher radiation exposure, as well as communication and navigation losses, forced trans-Atlantic flights to change course.

Pahalgam attack, Op Sindoor, strikes, ceasefire: Timeline of India-Pak tensionsThe ceasefire agreement followed days of retaliatory strikes and heightened tensions with Pakistan after India conducted cross-border strikes on terrorist camps.

10 satellites working round-the-clock to ensure India's securitySpeaking at the Central Agricultural University in Imphal, Isro chairman V Narayanan said that at least 10 satellites are working round-the-clock to ensure the safety and security of Indian citizens.

Taliban bans chess in Afghanistan, calls it against ShariaThe Taliban has suspended chess in Afghanistan, calling it a form of gambling banned under Sharia law. A sports official said the game won't return until religious concerns are resolved.

Indian techie lists office perks he gets in Sweden. Viral video sparks debateFrom generous time off to wellness allowances, a video by an Indian-origin techie listing the perks he receives at his Swedish office drew mixed reactions from users online.

Gautam Gambhir reacts to Virat Kohli's Test retirement: Will miss you CheeksIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir came up with a short, but emotional tribute to Virat Kohli after the star batter retired from Test cricket on Monday, May 12.

Delhi model, her lover get life term in 2018 murder case of school teacherSunita Sehrawat, a 38-year-old primary school teacher, was gunned down on October 29, 2018, while on her way to school by two hired shooters.

Viral video shows women clinging to moving Mumbai local train. Railways reactsThe viral video, posted by the X account Mumbai Railway Users, shows women clinging to the footboard of the overcrowded train.

SRK worked 36 hours straight on Circus, reveals co-star Renuka ShahaneRenuka Shahane recalled how Shah Rukh Khan worked tirelessly for 36 hours straight during the shoot of 'Circus.' She also shared a valuable piece of advice SRK gave her, which helped her overcome her fears on set.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli retires: Test cricket will feel quieter without its gladiatorVirat Kohli didn't just play Test cricket, he transformed it, leading with fire and pride. As he steps away from the longest format of the game, his legacy lingers in every fast bowler's swagger and every young cricketer's dream.

Gautam Gambhir reacts to Virat Kohli's Test retirement: Will miss you CheeksIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir came up with a short, but emotional tribute to Virat Kohli after the star batter retired from Test cricket on Monday, May 12.

Virat Kohli could've waited till England series before retiring: Madan LalFormer India fast bowler Madan Lal feels that star India batter Virat Kohli could've waited till the England tour to announce his retirement from Test cricket. Kohli called time on his Test career after playing 123 games and scoring 9230 runs.

Kohli retires as India's fourth-highest Test run-scorer: Career in numbersVirat Kohli retired from Test cricket with 9,230 runs from 123 Tests at an average of 46.85, including 30 centuries and 31 half-centuries. Kohli hung his boots before the tour of England, starting in June.

Why retired? Harbhajan Singh questions Virat Kohli after sudden retirement callFormer India off spinner Harbhajan Singh questioned star batter Virat Kohli for his sudden retirement from Test cricket ahead of the upcoming tour of England.

It's not easy, but it feels right: Kohli on Test retirementVirat Kohli retired from Test cricket on May 12, pulling the curtains down on a glorious 14-year-long career. He took the decision before India's five-match Test series against England.

Virat Kohli announces retirement from Tests, ending 14-year-long careerIndian star batter Virat Kohli announced his retirement from Test cricket on Monday, May 12, concluding a stellar 14-year journey in the format. The 36-year-old broke the news via Instagram, just ahead of India's upcoming five-Test series against England, starting June 20 at Headingley, Leeds.

Once a king always a king: Fans pay tribute to Virat Kohli after Test retirementFans paid an emotional tribute to the star India batter Virat Kohli, who announced his retirement from Test cricket ahead of the upcoming tour of England.

The 36-year-old shared a statement on his social media platforms, bringing the curtain down on a distinguished 14-year career spanning from 2011 to 2025.

Watch: Nurul Hasan's bizarre tactic costs Bangladesh A five penalty runsBangladesh were handed five penalty runs after the ball hit wicketkeeper Nurul Hasan Sohan's helmet during the match between Bangladesh A and New Zealand A on Saturday.

Rohit Sharma opens up on weakness against left-armers: Defending myself not my jobStar India batter Rohit Sharma recently opened up about his weakness against left-arm seamers and called it a part and parcel of the game. Rohit recently announced his retirement from Test cricket.

Praggnanandhaa remains in joint lead after draw with Vachier-LagraveIndian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa held Maxime Vachier-Lagrave to a draw, keeping both players tied at the top after five rounds of the Superbet Classic, a key event on the Grand Chess Tour.

Watch: Marinakis' heated chat with Nuno Espirito Santo after draw with Leicester CityNottingham Forest owner Evangelos Marinakis had a heated conversation with coach Nuno Espirito Santo over not substituting the injured Taiwo Awoniyi after the drawn fixture against Leicester city.

20-year-old Czech player hits out at trolls for targeting her motherItalian Open 2025: 20-year-old Linda Noskova from the Czech Republic slammed trolls for targeting her mother after her straight-sets defeat to Mirra Andreeva on Sunday.

Sneh Rana credits bowling coach for Player of the series performance in tri seriesIndia spinner Sneh Rana has credited team's bowling coach for her Player of the Series performance during India's tri-series triumph in Sri Lanka. India beat Sri Lanka by 97 runs in the final to clinch the tri-series title.

Navjot Sindhu wants 'match winner' Mohammed Shami in England despite poor formFormer India batter Navjot Singh Sidhu has backed fast bowler Mohammed Shami's selection for the upcoming tour of England despite his poor form in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Neeraj Chopra-led four Indians to compete in Doha Diamond League on May 16India's Javelin Throw star Neeraj Chopra is set to compete in the Doha leg of the prestigious Diamond League Meeting on May 16 along with three other compatriots.

Give Virat Kohli India Test captaincy for England series: Michael VaughanMichael Vaughan has made the bold claim that India should hand the Test captaincy to Virat Kohli for the upcoming England tour, which will begin on June 20. Kohli is considered as one of India's best Test captains of all time.

Arsenal fight back from 2-0 down to secure draw against LiverpoolArsenal fought back from a 2-0 deficit to claim a point against Liverpool at Anfield on Sunday, May 11. Despite going down to 10 men, Mikel Arteta's men showed character to hold on to the point.

Navjot Sindhu wants 'match winner' Mohammed Shami in England despite poor formFormer India batter Navjot Singh Sidhu has backed fast bowler Mohammed Shami's selection for the upcoming tour of England despite his poor form in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Kohli is considered as one of India's best Test captains of all time.

Arsenal fight back from 2-0 down to secure draw against LiverpoolArsenal fought back from a 2-0 deficit to claim a point against Liverpool at Anfield on Sunday, May 11. Despite going down to 10 men, Mikel Arteta's men showed character to hold on to the point.

Manchester United, Tottenham's Premier League woes continue ahead of Europa finalManchester United and Tottenham Hotspur's woes in the Premier League continued as they lost to West Ham United and Crystal Palace on Sunday, May 11. Both teams will faceoff in the Europa League final on May 21.

Just say India needs you, Virat Kohli will be available: Navjot Singh SidhuNavjot Singh Sidhu has claimed that Virat Kohli will forget about Test retirement and make himself available for the England tour if it is told that India needs him in the side. Sidhu feels Kohli gives balance to the Indian team.

Barcelona cleansweep Real Madrid in 2024-25, win 7-goal thrillerBarcelona overcame a 0-2 deficit to defeat Real Madrid 4-3 in a thrilling LaLiga match. This win strengthens their lead and boosts hopes of clinching the LaLiga title despite recent Champions League disappointment.

Lamine hits calma celebration, mocks Mbappe after scoring vs Real MadridBarcelona wonderboy Lamine Yamal scored a stunning curling goal in the El Clasico match on Sunday, May 11. His celebration echoed Cristiano Ronaldo's iconic 'calma', adding spice to the thrilling contest and taunting rivals.

RCB pacer Hazlewood's return for IPL 2025 in doubt after shoulder injury: ReportJosh Hazlewood's return for the remainder of the IPL 2025 season is in doubt as the Australian pacer is nursing an injury. Hazlewood has been in sensational form for RCB this season.

Jasprit Bumrah opts out of India Test captaincy race ahead of England tour: ReportJasprit Bumrah has opted out of the race to be India's Test team captain, according to a report from Sky Sports. Bumrah has been one of the names that was tipped for the post since Rohit Sharma announced his Test retirement.

India's 4x400m teams miss out on World Championship qualificationIndia's men's and mixed 4x400m relay teams failed to qualify for the World Championships in Tokyo. The teams now aim to secure the remaining berths through upcoming qualification events.

Watch: Hamburg fans invade pitch after Bundesliga promotion, 25 left hospitalised25 fans were left hospitalised after a pitch invasion happened following Hamburg's promotion to the Bundesliga on Saturday, May 10 after they defeated Ulm 6-1. Thousands of fans got on to the field with some suffering serious injuries.

Indian Test team after Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli: Possible squad for EnglandIndia prepares for a major transition ahead of the England Test series starting June 20. The retirement of Rohit Sharma and the possible exit of Virat Kohli marks a new leadership era under Shubman Gill.

Mandhana, Rana star as India hammer Sri Lanka by 97 runs to win tri-seriesIndia beat Sri Lanka by 97 runs in the final to win the tri-series in Colombo. Smriti Mandhana (116 off 101) and Sneh Rana (4/38) emerged as top performers in the commanding victory for the Women in Blue.

Not Kohli, but Jitesh was set to lead RCB vs LSG with Patidar injuredJitesh Sharma has revealed that he was about to captain RCB during their game against LSG on May 9, which was postponed after IPL 2025 was suspended for a week. RCB skipper Rajat Patidar was supposed to miss the game as he was nursing a finger injury.

Did Pakistan put Australian cricketers in harm's way while striking India?Pakistan has used civilian aircraft as shields while attacking India with drones. Reports that international cricketers took off just hours ago from the Nur Khan military airbase in Rawalpindi before it was hit, tallies with India's charge.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
